intro: Sarcolobus brachystephanus, commonly known as the short-step sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are succulent, adapted to store water, and it has a fibrous root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Sarcolobus brachystephanus is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh, drought-prone environments.
